intro: Conyza oligantha, commonly known as the lesser fleabane, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small annual herb that typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. The plant produces numerous small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Conyza oligantha is known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
